last_name: van Lith, Integrale Coach in Agile en Scrum
sub_title: ScrumMaster / Community Manager + waarom bestaat armoede?
summary:
Why haven't we solved systemic poverty? A simple question that Martin Luther King's last book planted into my mind.

A recent moment of connection with a homeless person allowed me to feel it as a deep desire. 
I felt compassion and love. 
I felt the urge to unleash and involve each individual's potential.
My mission is to solve future generations of poverty. 

There is also sadness and anger. When I see de-humanizing patterns that people can fall into. Or hear the denigrating, judgmental and hardness when people talk about "them". To me, they are signs that our systems have failed fundamentally. I don't believe in blaming the individual. 

At the same time, I am not driven by anger and sadness. It's the compassionate love I feel that convinces me to start this new journey.

It took me weeks to put these words out there. It's scary to claim this is my mission. It's easy to go beyond feeling embolden by having a mission, and start asking these realistic, but also limiting questions. 
* How does this fit my education & career till now? 
* Who am I to want change? How will I do it?
* Isn't it arrogant to claim I will solve a global phenomenon? 
* Is it even "right" to focus on systemic forces? Should I be starting with more local forms of poverty? 
* Is it even "right"  to focus on future generations? Should I be starting with the current generation? 

I am reaching out to you for help: 
1. Who collaborates on solving systemic poverty? 
2. Who should I seek out as a mentor?
3. What do you see as a next step for me as facilitator, coach and non-IT Agile specialist?
4. What questions are triggered in you?

Let's connect. I look forward to our discoveries.

projects.title: Certification of Shrimp and Pangasius product chains in Vietnam, 9.0
projects.description:
Student initiated summer-school, including visits to farms, processors and research institutes in Vietnam. We compared sustainability certification scheme's and mirrored them to the reality of Vietnamese Pangasius (catfish) and Shrimp production, processing and retailing.

Johan Verreth and Simon Bush guided and marked the summer-school.
Our observations, analysis and recommendations were bundled. Upon request, report will be sent to you!

profile_positions.description:
Can we truly transform the context within which we live our lives?
Will companies, governments, institutes, individuals, groups .... evolve?

For me, WeManity is about being able to give you inspiring, authentic "yes" stories. I will be telling stories about how we were the katalyst for change.

To be continued .... :)
profile_positions.title: Integrale Coach in Agile & Scrum

profile_positions.description:
"without delays" (Arie v. Bennekum, April 2022)

For me, Scrum and Agile are about two things:
1. regularly checking if we are doing the right things
2. finding out what teamwork is, its messiness in reality

Both mean nothing if we then run into various forms of "no".

I think I am most happy when we work together to have an impact. To create value. To intimately know the people who judge our value through their day-to-day experiencing of it. 

I have met so many talented and committed colleagues over the years. But were we really achieving our potential? Could we get more out of ourselves and our collaborative projects? Were we happy and soulful?

I don't think so.

How often did we finally finish our work. Then have it bounce around bureaucratically. Maybe have it launched ceremonially. After which we all move on to something else and never really find out if we had much impact. 

So to be happy, to be soulful, to leave this world a better place than it would otherwise would have been: I would like to work with you on delivering solutions "without delays".
profile_positions.title: Non-IT Scrum Master

profile_positions.description:
Together is the only way I would like to have it. Let's create connection. Unlock the diversity within the group. Give voice to the more hidden people, feelings, experiences and idea's. To maximize our potential of our group as whole. 

I am fascinated by how humans interact when we form groups. And it's not all hunky dory. We otherize, polarize, organize opposition, bully, powergrab, dominate, retreat, detach, avoid and ignore.

To be able to be a catalyst for us, I have invested in and un-developed myself:

1. Integrale Coaching (for groups)
I feel relaxed and responsive in comparison to the feisty and fun Kenny that I had been. I am grateful for the three years of body-centered study and practice I went through to become an Integral Coach. I have experienced that groups receive a boost when individuals are deeply present. Committing to my membership of our group means I commit to individually centering, spiritually connection and serving our group system. 

2. Facilitator using Liberating Structures (LS)
The LS community is amazing. I am in love and at home. Liberating Structures is also a creative toolbox  that is useful in any group setting, from project events to regular meetings. The motto is to "unleash and involve".

3. Community, Network, Guild - Management
"Power to the people", but how? There are many good examples of communities out there. I am a natural connector & energizer. And although "management" has some negative connotations, I have experienced that communities need active (servant) leadership. Communities seem to dissipate quite quickly if the head(s) of the snake is discontinued.
profile_positions.title: Facilitator, TeamCoach, Community Manager

profile_positions.description:
Summer 2018, hanging out at the bar of my girlfriend's work, I thought "how hard can it be? must be fun!". So, I asked if I could try-out. The conlusion: I can do this! And it's fun. The ambiance of Landhuis in the Stad (park Oog in Al. So homey!), colleagues, delicious food. Our colleagues with distance-to-normal-work pull me back down to earth. "doe maar normaal gek"

"Ik kan altijd nog barista worden!"
 -> wish come true, Landhuis & Nordkapp Coffee (Utrecht) taught me espresso and latte-art basics!
 -> In 2021 I am now diving deeper into the flavour paradise of Filter Coffee from various roasters in Utrecht. Look forward to exploring espresso through empiricism using a Decent. Orientation towards creating a fun and educative coffee tasting experience. Inspired by Tornqvist (Hamburg), Keen coffee (Utrecht), James Hoffman and the Decent Espresso community.

"Discipline leads to freedom"
 -> I've learned, it's even more so at restaurants & events. Great coordination and role-clarity first. That makes room for hospitality & welcoming our guests.
profile_positions.title: Hospitality / Horeca / Events

profile_positions.company: Ministry of Education, Culture and Science
profile_positions.description:
Proces begeleiding bij een klein team. Automatisering van subsidie processen bij Erfgoed en Kunsten. Een aantal thema's die stap voor stap aan bod kwamen:

1. Transparantie en accountability: wat er gebeurt als er via verschillende kanalen gecommuniceerd wordt. Ad-hoc uit je focus gehaald worden en de inefficiëntie van context-switching. Afspraken en vooral de redenering erachter die niet meer terug te vinden zijn. Disbalans werk-prive als er berichten na werktijd of in het weekend binnen komen.

2. Frustraties uitspreken. Inclusief de aanname dat we op gegeven moment concluderen dat het toch geen nut heeft. Terwijl de informatie onder de frustratie een doorbraak kan genereren in hoe we samenwerken. Dat kan ook gaan over hoe we binnen de organisatie samenwerken, niet alleen binnen het team.

3. Luisteren we wel? Voel je je gehoord? Wat herkennen we van elkaar? Waar zitten de verschillen? Kunnen we ook dat horen, zonder "goed/fout" erop te plakken? En kunnen we iets concreets afspreken?

4. Consequent zijn: de nadelen van tussentijds doelen veranderen. De focus die het brengt als dat steeds minder nodig blijkt te zijn.

5. "Wat bedoel je eigenlijk met ...?" hoeveel waarde het heeft als we nauwkeurig verfijnen hoe doelen omschreven zijn. Stap voor stap verbeteren van onze gewoontes.

6. Contact met doelgroepen: de kracht en valkuilen van een inhoudelijk sterke product-owner. Die de doelgroep dus ontzettend goed kan vertegenwoordigen. Maar ook de afstand die daardoor groter is tussen Team en Doelgroep. Het vergroten van interactie tijdens Reviews. De verkenning van behoeftes van Teamleden voor meer contact.

7. Afhankelijkheden met anderen in de (proces)-organisatie. De zwaktes van het stelsel als geheel.

8. Een mini-gilde van mede-scrummasters. Sparren als vakgenoten. Het verkennen (en niet vinden van) gezamenlijke organisatie belemmeringen.
profile_positions.title: Scrum Master

profile_positions.company: Ministry of Education, Culture and Science
profile_positions.description:
Rollen:
I. Community Manager van het TigersOCW. Een netwerk van collega's die naast hun primaire functie meters maken met creatieve processen begeleiden. Vanuit binnen het vakmanschap van Facilitatoren vergroten.

II. Scrum Master (zie aparte omschrijving)
 
III. Vakbroeder bij Organisatie Advies (vakgroep O-Advies). Bijdragen aan thema's als:
A. Opgave Gericht Werken
Wat is dat uberhaubt?
Wat is het verschil tussen een afdeling en een (multidisciplinair / dedicated) team?
Wie is er in beweging binnen OCW en hoe sluiten wij als vakgroep aan? 
Inkomende hulpaanvragen: vraagt dit om OGW of iets anders?
A. Teamcoaching
C. Facilitator van inhoudelijke sessies en heidagen
D. Digitalisering, samenwerken op afstand, hybride vergaderen&werken: wat moet P&O?
profile_positions.title: Pragmatisch P&O-er: Organisatie Adviseur

profile_positions.description: Developing relationships within the African fish farming sector. Bringing Nutreco knowhow and service to co-create aquaculture success. My tool: Skretting fishfeed, concentrates and formulation support.
profile_positions.title: Skretting fishfeed Africa, Feeding the Future

profile_positions.description:
Creating agriculture networks working towards communal goals. Defining success of synergy through impact on customer and future generations. A broad definition of "customer": individuals / society / balance with nature.

How: develop Oyster Mushroom projects
Goal: impact by openly offering our findings

Example:
Improving vegetable-production ecosystems by using plant "waste" to grow Oyster Mushrooms. Mushrooms put nutrients back into the system by breaking down fibres / woodyness. The production and harvesting process is hands-on work, an employment opportunity. Myceliation produces CO2 for vegetable-plant growth. Edible mushrooms are sold as an extra product of the farm.
profile_positions.title: Entrepreneur Circular Economy

profile_positions.description:
+ upgrading waste from a vegetable farm near Amsterdam using mushroom technology. Value addition through Diversification of production (luxurious mushrooms) and Circular economy (utilizing cellulitic waste, improving CO2 utilization and reducing emission, Waste-to-chicken-Feed). The project wil have a social impact by guaranteeing year-round work for the Social Enterprise and VitaminD rich products (Mushrooms & Eggs) for risk-groups (Social Employees and Foodbank). 
 + mushroom 'roots'​ (mycelium) applications: high protein, immunomodulating, gut-health, low calories, vitaminD
 + Feed opporutnities: Production animals (grow faster) Layer hen performance (more eggs) Young animal (immune development, disease prevention) Mother's Nurture (milk quality)
profile_positions.title: Projectleader Feed & Food

profile_positions.description: Run trials to further the young-pig (<25kg) portfolio: improving (gut)-health, combating Streptococcus suis.
profile_positions.title: Researcher piglets lifestart

profile_positions.description: We sell innovative seed-technology to seed-processing clients around the world. Our senior Researchers each have 30+ years of experience. Development is accelerated by turning clients into partners and enhancing technology with newly sourced ingredients. We also seek out non-seed concepts which have the potential to change our sector. Currently, projects cover priming, encrusting/pelleting, sanitation and probiotic-inoculation of vegetable and forage seeds. This includes installing machinery and user guidance.
profile_positions.title: Researcher vegetable seeds

profile_positions.description: Using simpler and high-throughput animal models to generate new knowledge on probiotics and mutualistic relationships. Gene-Trait-Matching approach using 40+ Lactobacillus plantarum isolates mono-associated to fly larvae to unravel the host-microbe-interaction. Quantification of gut loads  as phenotype as well as growth trials on alternative diets (replacement of yeast with pure protein source).
profile_positions.title: Gut Microbiome MSc Minor-Thesis, 8.5
